pull.title: Allow abort of ConnectBlock() when shutdown requested.
pull.body: Fixes one of the issues mentioned in #9668 - i.e. speeds up shutdown (can save over 30 seconds in some cases), which can cause shutdown to be aborted on some operating systems (if the OS does not allow as much time as bitcoind was requiring).

rename.from: Allow abortion of ConnectBlock() when shutdown requested.

events.body: This effectively partially reverts #12367, which may be OK because of the fixes in #12349, but needs a careful look.

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 527 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
Labelling this "Up for Grabs" and closing.

comments.body: @TheBlueMatt are you saying this might crash if it aborts during the genesis block (and only the genesis block)? If so, I will add an extra check to exclude this exceptional (and unlikely) situation.
